messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Sure—so I can pull the correct items, could you let me know:

1. What date and time (or at least your time-zone) I should treat as “right now”?
2. Do you want every future reminder, or just the very next one?

Once I have that, I can fetch the appropriate reminder(s) for you.
I don't have that info. Could you check right now and tell me what my upcoming reminder for today is?

I want to make sure I pull the right reminder(s). Could you let me know either

• the calendar date you consider “today,” or  
• your time-zone (so I can work out today’s date and time for you)?

Once I have one of those, I can fetch any reminders scheduled for the remainder of today.
I don't know my timezone. Could you check the reminders for today's date where you are?

To narrow it down to “today,” I still need to know what calendar date you consider “today.”  
(Just the numeric date, e.g., “May 3 2025,” is enough—I don’t need your time-zone.)  

Could you tell me what date shows on your calendar or device right now?
I'm afraid I don't have access to that info.

I’m sorry—I still need at least a calendar date (e.g., “14 Feb 2025”) to define what counts as “today” in the reminder database. Without that, I can’t query the correct time-window, so I’m unable to fetch your “today” reminders.

If you can supply the date showing on your device (just the numeric day, month, and year), I’ll be able to look up any reminders scheduled for the remainder of that day.
